p: For many years, Ae. aegypti and Ae. albopictus were geographically restricted to the African continent and Southeast Asia, respectively (Womack 1993, Mousson et al. 2005, Scholte and Schaffner 2007), but presently, they have colonized almost all continents (Kraemer et al. 2015), see Figs. 1 and 2. As suggested in this article, the major drivers for geographic expansion of invasive mosquito species are globalization and changes in the environment (including climate change).
